name: GIST Esophagus T
title: Clinical and Pathological T
notes:
**Note 1:** TNM does not include an in situ category for carcinoid tumors of appendix. Assign TX and behavior code /2 for in situ cases.

**Note 2:**  Ignore intraluminal extension to adjacent segment(s) of colon; code depth of invasion or extra-appendiceal spread as indicated.

**Note 3:** Tumor size must be known to assign a T value. You may use a physicianâs statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record. If no tumor size is available, assign TX.

**Note 4:** For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category based on the tumor size.

    Tumor confined to muscular wall
    Tumor invades through submucosa and muscularis mucosae to   involve with mucosa

    Localized, NOS
   
    Adventitia and/or soft tissue invaded
    Esophagus described as fixed
    Invasion into adventitia with invasion of/through mucosa
    Invasion of adjacent structures:
    Cervical esophagus 
    Blood vessel(s), major:
    Carina
    Carotid artery
    Cervical vertebraâ¬
    Hypopharynx
    Jugular vein
          Larynx
          Thyroid gland 
    Subclavian artery
    Trachea
    
**Thoracic/middle esophagus:**

      Pericardium

**Abdominal/lower esophagus:**

    Diaphragm fixed

**Intrathoracic, upper or mid-portion, esophagus:**

    Blood vessel(s), major:
        Aorta 
        Azygos vein
        Pulmonary artery/vein 
        Vena cava 
    Carina
    Diaphragm 
    Main stem bronchus 
    Trachea 

**Intrathoracic, lower portion (abdominal), esophagus:**

    Blood vessel(s), major: 
        Aorta 
       Gastric artery/vein
        Vena cava
rows:
In situ, intraepithelial, noninvasive
Unknown; extension not stated
Not documented in patient record

Confined to esophagus and size not known
Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension
Tumor more than 5 cm but not more than 10 cm in greatest dimension
Tumor more than 10 cm in greatest dimension
